title: Modeling, Simulation, and Analysis
description: Model-driven architecture and development concepts, business process and workflow modeling, structured analysis and IDEF modeling methods, object-, component- and service-orientation and the Unified Modeling Language, event and stream models, colored Petri nets, executable architectures, distributed simulation for performance analysis. This course will meet from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. every alternating Friday and Saturday. Prerequisites: enrollment in MAS-AESE, MGT 291, AESE 278A-B, or instructor approval. AESE 278C is cross-listed with CSE 278C, ECE 206, and MAE 278A.
